author: marekm3498
content:
Hey,

We performed sync testing with different client pairs. Full archive sync without checkpoint endpoint.

Batch 1:
EL:  nethermind, ethereumjs
CL: nimbus, prysm, teku, lighthouse, lodestar
Forkmon: http://66.228.57.139:8080/
Ethstats: http://66.228.57.139:8081/
Batch 2:
EL: geth, erigon, besu
CL: nimbus, prysm, teku, lighthouse, lodestar
Forkmon: http://45.79.202.238:8080/ 
Ethstats: http://45.79.202.238:8081/

Results:
1. Prysm can't sync with all ELs
2. Lodestar can't sync with all ELs (always stuck on block 315). I will share exception below. Based on exception message it might be expected output.
3. Erigon-nimbus is always a few blocks behind the tip of the chain.
4. There was invalid block messages in logs in EthereumJS<>Nimbus, but this pair manage to sync. So I guess other pairs produce invalid blocks on devnet. I will share exception below.
5. Other client pairs managed to sync üôÇ

author: tersec
content: is this a beaoncha.in type system using a light client, using a light (JS-free or etc) UI, or?

author: barnabasbusa
content: The light beaconchain is developed by pk910 not the beaconchain team. Its light as it doesn't have any validator statistics, and thus setting it up, and running it should be a lot lighter than the full blown beaconchain explorer
